title: Crash report: Failed to verify deposit data, verifying signatures individually error=one or more deposit signatures did not verify
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description After upgrading to v1.0.0-beta.2 and restarting beacon-chain, software hangs at start and crashes after a while. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Same error is happening now after downgrading to v1.0.0-beta.1 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 

./beacon-chain \
    --grpc-gateway-port=2250 \
    --grpc-gateway-host=$XXX \
    --medalla \
    --http-web3provider=http://$XXX:8545/ \
    --p2p-max-peers=100 \
    --slots-per-archive-point=32 \
    --monitoring-host=$XXX \
    --monitoring-port=8080  \
    --accept-terms-of-use \
    --verbosity=debug \
     --head-sync  \
    --log-file /tmp/beacon.log
Tried it both with --head-sync on and off ## üî• Error 

runtime.goexit
	GOROOT/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1373
[2020-11-12 09:54:44] DEBUG blocks: Skipping deposit: could not verify deposit data signature: signature did not verify
[2020-11-12 09:54:44] DEBUG blocks: Skipping deposit: could not verify deposit data signature: signature did not verify

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Linux 4.19.0-11-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.19.146-1 (2020-09-17) x86_64 GNU/Linux
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
binary release:
v1.0.0-beta.2
also on
v1.0.0-beta.1

The invalid deposits are normal logs, when someone sends an invalid deposit. Medalla has several of those.

Can you post the whole logs? I wonder why it is crashing. Is it out of memory?

Not sure if this is related, but after it was killed by the kernel for OOM, I am unable to restart beacon-chain and it gives this error as well as another error that was fixed/referenced in  https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/3733

Latest Prysm version is v1.0.0-beta.2.
Beacon chain is up to date.
